    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentJvmDir

        public static java.nio.file.Path getCurrentJvmDir()
        The path to the directory containing the executable of the currently running JVM. This is given by the java.home system property and will be different, in general, from the JAVA_HOME environment variable as the latter is usually set to the base installation directory whereas the former is typically the JRE directory. Also note that if multiple JVM's are installed on the host, this method will always return the path to the currently executing JVM which may be different from that of the default JVM on the system.
        Returns:
        The absolute path to the directory containing this JVM's executable.

      • findCurrentJvmExecutable

        public static java.util.Optional<java.nio.file.Path> findCurrentJvmExecutable()
        The absolute path to the executable of the currently running JVM. This method returns a value only if the java command could be determined and the file actually exists; an empty optional is returned otherwise.
        Returns:
        the path, if it can be determined.
